properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Cohuna. 
  • There is a bushfire at Cohuna Island Road, Cohuna.
  • A tree is alight in Gunbower Creek.
  • Firefighters are currently monitoring the situation.
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Cohuna Island Road, Cohuna
Issue Date: Saturday 01 November 2025, 09:14 pm
Next Update: Sunday 02 November 2025, 10:30 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38355/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Cohuna. 
- There is a bushfire at Cohuna Island Road, Cohuna.
- A tree is alight in Gunbower Creek.
- Firefighters are currently monitoring the situation.
- Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads.  


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Kennedys Creek, east of Bones Track and south of Sheepyard Track
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Kennedys Creek, east of Bones Track and south of Sheepyard Track.
There is a bushfire at 2.5Km East Of Kennedys Creek that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Bones Track in a easterly direction towards Sheepyard Track. 
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 7:04pm.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Bulldozers and are operating in the area.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 02/11/2025 01:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Harrow. 
  • There is a bushfire on Haylocks Road, Harrow.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • The fire is expected to burn overnight and into tomorrow, Sunday 2 November 2025. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright.
  • Victoria Police advises the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues. 
  • Mount Buffalo National Park fully reopened to the public on Friday 24 October, following advice from Victoria Police.
  • The full details are available on the Parks Victoria website, with staff also patrolling the park.
  • Victoria Police advises those in the area to remain vigilant and report any suspicious behaviour to Triple Zero (000) or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. 
This Community Information replaces the message issued on Tuesday 21 October.
If you see Desmond Freeman (Filby), call Triple Zero (000) immediately and do not approach the offender. 
What you should do:
  • If you are in the Porepunkah area, you must follow instructions of emergency services at the scene.
  • Anyone who witnessed the incident or has any information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or www.crimestoppers.com.au.
Impacts in your area:
  • Road closures may change at short notice. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website for updates on road closures: traffic.transport.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by Victoria Police.

The next update is expected by 03/11/2025 05:30 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency app
  • VicEmergency Facebook or Twitter
  • Victoria Police Facebook or Twitter
  • For more information, visit: Victoria Police - Porepunkah incident
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment, contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - DANGEROUS PERSON - Remain Vigilant Incident Location: Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright Issue Date: Saturday 25 October 2025, 12:31 pm Next Update: Monday 03 November 2025, 05:30 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38321/moreinfo This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright. - Victoria Police advises the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues. - Mount Buffalo National Park fully reopened to the public on Friday 24 October, following advice from Victoria Police. - The full details are available on the Parks Victoria website, with staff also patrolling the park. - Victoria Police advises those in the area to remain vigilant and report any suspicious behaviour to Triple Zero (000) or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. This Community Information replaces the message issued on Tuesday 21 October. If you see Desmond Freeman (Filby), call Triple Zero (000) immediately and do not approach the offender.
